Package ohos.agp.text

Class RichText

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.agp.text.RichText
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Appendable, CharSequence

    public final class RichText
extends Object
implements Appendable, CharSequence
    Represents rich text in different formats.

    This class is the combination of Text and RichStyle. You can use setRichStyle(ohos.agp.text.richstyles.RichStyle, int, int, ohos.agp.text.richstyles.RangedRichStyle.Flag) to add a rich style for the text.

    Since:
    3

      This change is effective since API version 8. Replaced by ClickRichStyle.

        Parameters:
        text - Indicates the plain text, which can be null.
        Since:
        7

        Parameters:
        richText - Indicates the rich text, which cannot be null.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the specified richText is null.
        Since:

        Specified by:

        Returns:

        Throws:

      • addTouchEventListener

        @Deprecated
public void addTouchEventListener​(RichText.TouchEventListener listener,
                                  int start,
                                  int end)
        Deprecated. This change is effective since API version 8. Replaced by ClickRichStyle.
        Adds a listener to listen for a touch event on a specific rich text paragraph.
        Parameters:
        listener - Indicates the touch event listener to add.
        start - Indicates the start position of the rich text paragraph that responds to a touch event.
        end - Indicates the end position of the rich text paragraph that responds to a touch event.
        Since:
        3

      • setLeadingMargin

        @Deprecated
public void setLeadingMargin​(int firstMargin,
                             int restMargin)
        Deprecated. This change is effective since API version 8. Replaced by IndentRichStyle.
        Sets the leading margins for this rich text paragraph.
        Parameters:
        firstMargin - Indicates the margin of the first line in the paragraph, in pixels.
        restMargin - Indicates the margin of the other lines in the paragraph, in pixels.
        Since:
        3

      • getLeadingMargin

        @Deprecated
public int getLeadingMargin​(boolean firstMargin)
        Deprecated. This change is effective since API version 8. Replaced by IndentRichStyle.
        Obtains the leading margins of this rich text paragraph.
        Parameters:
        firstMargin - Specifies whether to obtain the leading margin of the first line or the other lines of this rich text paragraph. The value true means to obtain the margin of the first line, and false means to obtain the margin of the other lines.
        Returns:
        Returns the leading margins, in pixels.
        Since:
        3

      • getRangedRichStylesByTypeId

        public List<RangedRichStyle> getRangedRichStylesByTypeId​(int start,
                                                         int end,
                                                         RichStyle.TypeId typeId)
        Obtains the list of rich styles of the specified typeId in a given range of this rich text.
        Parameters:
        start - Indicates the start position in the rich text.
        end - Indicates the end position in the rich text.
        typeId - Indicates a RichStyle.TypeId object.
        Returns:
        Returns a list of RangedRichStyle objects, each of which includes a rich style, its coverage, and its inclusion relationship if obtained; returns the List that contains zero elements if no data is found.
        Since:
        7

      • getRangedRichStylesByCapability

        public List<RangedRichStyle> getRangedRichStylesByCapability​(int start,
                                                             int end,
                                                             int capability)
        Obtains the list of rich styles corresponding to the capability in the given range of this rich text.
        Parameters:
        start - Indicates the start position in the rich text.
        end - Indicates the end position in the rich text.
        capability - Indicates the capability of a rich style, which affects the character appearance and paragraph presentation. For details, see RichStyle.Capability.
        Returns:
        Returns a list of RangedRichStyle objects, each of which includes a rich style, its coverage, and its inclusion relationship if obtained; returns the List that contains zero elements if no data is found.
        Since:
        7

      • getRangedRichStyle

        public RangedRichStyle getRangedRichStyle​(RichStyle richStyle)
        Obtains the coverage and inclusion relationship of the specified rich style in this rich text.
        Parameters:
        richStyle - Indicates the style of the rich text.
        Returns:
        Returns a RangedRichStyle object, which includes a rich style, its coverage, and its inclusion relationship if obtained; returns null if no data is found.
        Since:
        7

      • setRichStyle

        public void setRichStyle​(RichStyle richStyle,
                         int start,
                         int end,
                         RangedRichStyle.Flag includeFlag)
        Sets a RichStyle for this rich text.

        You must specify a richStyle, its start and end positions (start and end) in the string, and the inclusion relationship (includeFlag) for adding text to the left and right boundaries. Note: An exception is thrown if the range specified by start and end is incorrect. If a rich style is set for multiple times, only the last setting is retained.

        Parameters:
        richStyle - Indicates the rich style to set.
        start - Indicates the start position in the rich text.
        end - Indicates the end position in the rich text.
        includeFlag - Indicates the inclusion relationship. For details, see RangedRichStyle.Flag.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the value of richStyle is null, exceeds the text length, or is negative.
        Since:
        7

      • setRichStyle

        public void setRichStyle​(RangedRichStyle rangedRichStyle)
        Sets a RangedRichStyle for this rich text.

        rangedRichStyle specifies the rich style, start position, end position, and inclusion relationship for adding text to the left and right boundaries. Note: If a rich style is set for multiple times, only the last setting is retained.

        Parameters:
        rangedRichStyle - Indicates the RichStyle data structure stored in the rich text, which contains the start position, end position, and inclusion relationship.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the value of rangedRichStyle is null, exceeds the text length, or is negative.
        Since:
        7

      • findNextTransitionPointByTypeId

        public int findNextTransitionPointByTypeId​(int start,
                                           int end,
                                           RichStyle.TypeId typeId)
        Obtains the next transition point of a rich style in the range specified by start and end based on the typeId.
        Parameters:
        start - Indicates the start position in the rich text. start is not included.
        end - Indicates the end position in the rich text. end is included.
        typeId - Indicates a RichStyle.TypeId object.
        Returns:
        Returns the next transition point if obtained; returns end if no data is found.
        Since:
        7

      • findNextTransitionPointByCapability

        public int findNextTransitionPointByCapability​(int start,
                                               int end,
                                               int capability)
        Obtains the next transition point of a rich style in the range specified by start and end based on the capability.
        Parameters:
        start - Indicates the start position in the rich text. start is not included.
        end - Indicates the end position in the rich text. end is included.
        capability - Indicates the capability of a rich style, which affects the character appearance and paragraph presentation. For details, see RichStyle.Capability.
        Returns:
        Returns the next transition point if obtained; returns end if no data is found.
        Since:
        7

      • findAllTransitionPointsByTypeId

        public List<Integer> findAllTransitionPointsByTypeId​(int start,
                                                     int end,
                                                     RichStyle.TypeId typeId)
        Obtains all the transition points of a rich style in the range specified by start and end based on the typeId.
        Parameters:
        start - Indicates the start position in the rich text. start is not included.
        end - Indicates the end position in the rich text. end is included.
        typeId - Indicates a RichStyle.TypeId object.
        Returns:
        Returns all the transition points.
        Since:
        7

      • findAllTransitionPointsByCapability

        public List<Integer> findAllTransitionPointsByCapability​(int start,
                                                         int end,
                                                         int capability)

        Parameters:
        start - Indicates the start position in the rich text. start is not included.
        end - Indicates the end position in the rich text. end is included.
        capability - Indicates the capability of a rich style, which affects the character appearance and paragraph presentation. For details, see RichStyle.Capability.
        Returns:
        Returns all the transition points.
        Since:
        7

        Parameters:

      • replace

        public void replace​(int start,
                    int end,
                    String text)
        Replaces the content in the range specified by start and end of this rich text with the text.

        Note:

        1. If the old content in the specified range contains a rich style, this rich style automatically applies to the new text.
        2. If the specified range is incorrect or the text to be used for replacement is null, the replacement operation will not be performed.
        Parameters:
        start - Indicates the start position in the rich text.
        end - Indicates the end position in the rich text.
        text - Indicates the text to be used for replacement.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if an input parameter is invalid.
        Since:
        7

      • replace

        public void replace​(int start,
                    int end,
                    RichText richText)
        Replaces the content in the range specified by start and end of this rich text with the richText.

        Note:

        1. If the old content in the specified range contains a rich style, this rich style automatically applies to the new text.
        2. If the specified range is incorrect or the text to be used for replacement is null, the replacement operation will not be performed.
        Parameters:
        start - Indicates the start position in the rich text.
        end - Indicates the end position in the rich text.
        richText - Indicates the rich text to be used for replacement.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if an input parameter is invalid.
        Since:
        7

      • replace

        public void replace​(int start,
                    int end,
                    String text,
                    int textStart,
                    int textEnd)
        Replaces the content in the range specified by start and end of this rich text with the content in the range specified by textStart and textEnd in the text.

        Note:

        1. If the old content in the specified range contains a rich style, this rich style automatically applies to the new text.
          2. *
        2. If the specified range is incorrect or the text to be used for replacement is null, the replacement operation will not be performed.
        Parameters:
        start - Indicates the start position in the rich text.
        end - Indicates the end position in the rich text.
        text - Indicates the text to be used for replacement.
        textStart - Indicates the start position in the text to be used for replacement.
        textEnd - Indicates the end position in the text to be used for replacement.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if an input parameter is invalid.
        Since:
        7

      • replace

        public void replace​(int start,
                    int end,
                    RichText richText,
                    int textStart,
                    int textEnd)
        Replaces the content in the range specified by start and end of this rich text with the content in the range specified by textStart and textEnd in the richText.

        Note:

        1. If the old content in the specified range contains a rich style, this rich style automatically applies to the new text.
        2. If the specified range is incorrect or the text to be used for replacement is null, the replacement operation will not be performed.
        Parameters:
        start - Indicates the start position in the rich text.
        end - Indicates the end position in the rich text.
        richText - Indicates the rich text to be used for replacement.
        textStart - Indicates the start position in the rich text to be used for replacement.
        textEnd - Indicates the end position in the rich text to be used for replacement.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if an input parameter is invalid.
        Since:
        7

        public void deleteAll​()
        Deletes the text and all rich styles from this rich text.
        Since:
        7

        public void deleteRichStyles​()
        Deletes all the rich styles from this rich text.
        Since:

      • delete

        public void delete​(int start,
                   int end)
        Deletes the text and rich style in the range specified by start and end from this rich text. No deletion is performed if the input parameters are invalid.
        Parameters:
        start - Indicates the start position in the rich text.
        end - Indicates the end position in the rich text.
        Since:
        7

      • insert

        public void insert​(int position,
                   String text)
        Inserts the specified text into the position of this rich text.

        Note:

        1. If the position contains a rich style, this rich style automatically applies to the inserted text.
        2. If the position is incorrect or the text to insert is null, the insertion operation will not be performed.
        Parameters:
        position - Indicates the position where the text will be inserted.
        text - Indicates the text to insert.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if an input parameter is invalid.
        Since:
        7

      • insert

        public void insert​(int position,
                   RichText richText)
        Inserts the specified rich text into the position of this rich text.

        Note:

        1. If the position contains a rich style, this rich style automatically applies to the inserted text.
        2. If the position is incorrect or the text to insert is null, the insertion operation will not be performed.
        Parameters:
        position - Indicates the position where the rich text will be inserted.
        richText - Indicates the rich text to insert.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if an input parameter is invalid.
        Since:
        7

      • insert

        public void insert​(int position,
                   String text,
                   int textStart,
                   int textEnd)
        Inserts the content in the range specified by textStart and textEnd in the text into the position of this rich text.

        2. If the position is incorrect or the text to insert is null, the insertion operation will not be performed.
        Parameters:
        position - Indicates the position where the text will be inserted.
        text - Indicates the text to insert.
        textStart - Indicates the start position in the text to insert.
        textEnd - Indicates the end position in the text to insert.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if an input parameter is invalid.
        Since:
        7

      • insert

        public void insert​(int position,
                   RichText richText,
                   int textStart,
                   int textEnd)
        Inserts the content in the range specified by textStart and textEnd in the richText into the position of this rich text.

        Note:

        1. If the position contains a rich style, this rich style automatically applies to the inserted text.
        2. If the position is incorrect or the text to insert is null, the insertion operation will not be performed.
        Parameters:

        richText - Indicates the rich text to insert.
        textStart - Indicates the start position in the rich text to insert.
        textEnd - Indicates the end position in the rich text to insert.
        Throws:
